title: Indexes
subject: Database Management Systems
theory:
Data structure (usually B-Tree) to speed up retrieval. 
- **Clustered**: Sorts the actual data on disk (Only 1 per table). PK is usually Clustered.
- **Non-Clustered**: Separate structure pointing to data (Like book index).

examples.code:
Without Index: Full Table Scan (O(n)).
With Index: B-Tree Search (O(log n)).

common_mistakes.correction: Indexes speed up Reads but Slow down Writes (Insert/Update must update index).

interview_questions.question: What is a Composite Index?
interview_questions.answer: Index on multiple columns. Order matters (Leftmost prefix rule).
